issue.title: Unitconversions module does not belong in labscript_utils

content.raw:
I have a different idea for this that might be better.

You keep UnitConversionBase.py in labscript utils (move it to top level) as that should not change very often.
You make the user specify the python module name in lab config (or multiple module names) which contain the unitconversion classes. The name specified must be importable with import <modulename> from a Python terminal.

We can autocreate a module in the Pythonlib folder new users, but this gives "power users" the flexibility to do what they want with the location of the unitconversions.

thoughts?
